trans-unit.source: Single sign-on with Azure Active Directory (PHP)
trans-unit.target: Single sign-on with Azure Active Directory (PHP)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a PHP web application that uses single sign-on with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a PHP web application that uses single sign-on with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will show PHP developers how to leverage Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on for users of Office 365 customers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will show PHP developers how to leverage Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on for users of Office 365 customers.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to:
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Provision the web application in a customer's tenant
trans-unit.target: Provision the web application in a customer's tenant

trans-unit.source: Protect the application using WS-Federation
trans-unit.target: Protect the application using WS-Federation

trans-unit.source: The following development environment prerequisites are required for this walkthrough:
trans-unit.target: The following development environment prerequisites are required for this walkthrough:

trans-unit.source: [PHP Sample Code for Azure Active Directory]
trans-unit.target: [PHP Sample Code for Azure Active Directory]

trans-unit.source: [Eclipse PDT 3.0.x All In Ones]
trans-unit.target: [Eclipse PDT 3.0.x All In Ones]

trans-unit.source: PHP 5.3.1 (via Web Platform Installer)
trans-unit.target: PHP 5.3.1 (via Web Platform Installer)

trans-unit.source: Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.5 with SSL enabled
trans-unit.target: Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.5 with SSL enabled

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: [Office 365 PowerShell Commandlets]
trans-unit.target: [Office 365 PowerShell Commandlets]

trans-unit.source: This step describes how to create a simple PHP application that will represent a protected resource.
trans-unit.target: This step describes how to create a simple PHP application that will represent a protected resource.

trans-unit.source: Access to this resource will be granted through federated authentication managed by the company's STS, which is described later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Access to this resource will be granted through federated authentication managed by the company's STS, which is described later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Open a new instance of Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: Open a new instance of Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click New, then click New PHP Project.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click New, then click New PHP Project.

trans-unit.source: On the New PHP Project dialog, name the project phpSample, then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the New PHP Project dialog, name the project phpSample, then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: From the PHP Explorer menu on the left, right-click phpProject, click New, then click PHP File.
trans-unit.target: From the PHP Explorer menu on the left, right-click phpProject, click New, then click PHP File.

trans-unit.source: On the New PHP File dialog, name the file index.php, then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the New PHP File dialog, name the file index.php, then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Replace the generated markup with the following, then save index.php:
trans-unit.target: Replace the generated markup with the following, then save index.php:

trans-unit.source: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager by typing inetmgr at the Run prompt and pressing Enter.
trans-unit.target: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager by typing inetmgr at the Run prompt and pressing Enter.

trans-unit.source: In IIS Manager, expand the Sites folder in the left menu, right-click Default Website, then click Add Application....
trans-unit.target: In IIS Manager, expand the Sites folder in the left menu, right-click Default Website, then click Add Application....

trans-unit.source: On the Add Application dialog, set the Alias value to phpSample and the Physical path to the file path where you created the PHP project.
trans-unit.target: On the Add Application dialog, set the Alias value to phpSample and the Physical path to the file path where you created the PHP project.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, from the Run menu, click Run.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, from the Run menu, click Run.

trans-unit.source: On the Run PHP Web Application menu, click OK.
trans-unit.target: On the Run PHP Web Application menu, click OK.

trans-unit.source: The index.php page will open in a new tab in Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: The index.php page will open in a new tab in Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: The page should simply display the text: Index Page.
trans-unit.target: The page should simply display the text: Index Page.

trans-unit.source: This step describes how an administrator of an Azure Active Directory customer provisions the PHP application in their tenant and configures single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: This step describes how an administrator of an Azure Active Directory customer provisions the PHP application in their tenant and configures single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: After this step is accomplished, the company's employees can authenticate to the web application using their Office 365 accounts.
trans-unit.target: After this step is accomplished, the company's employees can authenticate to the web application using their Office 365 accounts.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning process begins by creating a new Service Principal for the application.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning process begins by creating a new Service Principal for the application.

trans-unit.source: Service Principals are used by Azure Active Directory to register and authenticate applications to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Service Principals are used by Azure Active Directory to register and authenticate applications to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Download and install the Office 365 PowerShell Commandlets if you haven't done so already.
trans-unit.target: Download and install the Office 365 PowerShell Commandlets if you haven't done so already.

trans-unit.source: From the Start menu, run the Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: From the Start menu, run the Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: This console provides a command-line environment for configuring attributes about your Office 365 tenant, such as creating and modifying Service Principals.
trans-unit.target: This console provides a command-line environment for configuring attributes about your Office 365 tenant, such as creating and modifying Service Principals.

trans-unit.source: To import the required MSOnlineExtended module, type the following command and press Enter:
trans-unit.target: To import the required MSOnlineExtended module, type the following command and press Enter:

trans-unit.source: To connect to your Office 365 directory, you will need to provide the company's administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: To connect to your Office 365 directory, you will need to provide the company's administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command and press Enter, then enter your credential's at the prompt:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command and press Enter, then enter your credential's at the prompt:

trans-unit.source: Now you will create a new Service Principal for the application.
trans-unit.target: Now you will create a new Service Principal for the application.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command and press Enter:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command and press Enter:

trans-unit.source: You should save this output, especially the generated symmetric key.
trans-unit.target: You should save this output, especially the generated symmetric key.

trans-unit.source: This key is only revealed to you during Service Principal creation, and you will be unable to retrieve it in the future.
trans-unit.target: This key is only revealed to you during Service Principal creation, and you will be unable to retrieve it in the future.

trans-unit.source: The other values are required for using the Graph API to read and write information in the directory.
trans-unit.target: The other values are required for using the Graph API to read and write information in the directory.

trans-unit.source: The final step sets the reply URL for your application.
trans-unit.target: The final step sets the reply URL for your application.

trans-unit.source: The reply URL is where responses are sent following authentication attempts.
trans-unit.target: The reply URL is where responses are sent following authentication attempts.

trans-unit.source: Type the following commands and press enter:
trans-unit.target: Type the following commands and press enter:

trans-unit.source: The web application has now been provisioned in the directory and it can be used for web single sign-on by company employees.
trans-unit.target: The web application has now been provisioned in the directory and it can be used for web single sign-on by company employees.

trans-unit.source: This step shows you how to add support for federated login using Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) and the simpleSAML.php libraries you downloaded with the sample code in the prerequisites.
trans-unit.target: This step shows you how to add support for federated login using Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) and the simpleSAML.php libraries you downloaded with the sample code in the prerequisites.

trans-unit.source: You will also add a login page and configure trust between the application and the directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: You will also add a login page and configure trust between the application and the directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, right-click the phpSample project, click New, then click File.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, right-click the phpSample project, click New, then click File.

trans-unit.source: On the New File dialog, name the file federation.ini, then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the New File dialog, name the file federation.ini, then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: In the new federation.ini file, enter the following information, supplying the values with the information you saved in Step 2 when creating your Service Principal:
trans-unit.target: In the new federation.ini file, enter the following information, supplying the values with the information you saved in Step 2 when creating your Service Principal:

trans-unit.source: The audienceuris and realm values must be prefaced by "spn:".
trans-unit.target: The audienceuris and realm values must be prefaced by "spn:".

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, right-click the phpSample project, click New, then click PHP File.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, right-click the phpSample project, click New, then click PHP File.

trans-unit.source: On the New PHP File dialog, name the file secureResource.php, then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the New PHP File dialog, name the file secureResource.php, then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: In the new secureResource.php file, enter the following code, replacing the c:\phpLibraries path with the root location where you downloaded the sample code.
trans-unit.target: In the new secureResource.php file, enter the following code, replacing the c:\phpLibraries path with the root location where you downloaded the sample code.

trans-unit.source: The root location should include the simpleSAML.php file and federation folder:
trans-unit.target: The root location should include the simpleSAML.php file and federation folder:

trans-unit.source: Open the index.php page and update its contents to secure the page, then save it:
trans-unit.target: Open the index.php page and update its contents to secure the page, then save it:

trans-unit.source: From the Run menu, click Run.
trans-unit.target: From the Run menu, click Run.

trans-unit.source: You should automatically be redirected to the Office 365 Identity Provider page, where you can log in using your directory tenant credentials.
trans-unit.target: You should automatically be redirected to the Office 365 Identity Provider page, where you can log in using your directory tenant credentials.

trans-unit.source: For example, john.doe@fabrikam.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, john.doe@fabrikam.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial has shown you how to create and configure a single tenant PHP application that uses the single sign-on capabilities of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial has shown you how to create and configure a single tenant PHP application that uses the single sign-on capabilities of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: A sample that shows how to use Azure Active Directory and single sign-on for PHP websites is available at <https://github.com/WindowsAzure/azure-sdk-for-php-samples/tree/master/WAAD.WebSSO.PHP>.
trans-unit.target: A sample that shows how to use Azure Active Directory and single sign-on for PHP websites is available at <https://github.com/WindowsAzure/azure-sdk-for-php-samples/tree/master/WAAD.WebSSO.PHP>.
